  1. News & Announcements

  1. Register Your Dog Before the Deadline!

    All Wellesley dog owners must register their pets and pay for 2019 dog licenses by Monday, April 1 to avoid fines. Payments may be made online, by mail or in person at Town Hall. Read on...

  2. NRC Seeks Candidates for 1-Year Appointment

    The Natural Resources Commission has a vacancy and is seeking applications from Wellesley residents to fill a one-year appointed position. The deadline to apply is Friday, April 5. Read on...

  3. Jeff Azano-Brown Named DPW Assistant Director

    Jeff Azano-Brown will be the new Assistant Director of the Department of Public Works (DPW). Read on...

  4. DPW "Brew" Helps 2019 Snow Removal

    This winter, the Department of Public Works used a de-icing liquid as part of its snow removal plan. See how this natural solution works. Read on...

  5. Save the Date: Special Town Meeting on May 13

    The Board of Selectmen will convene a Special Town Meeting at the Wellesley Middle School Auditorium on Monday, May 13, 2019 at 7:00 p.m. Read on...

  6. RDF Spring Schedule

    Beginning in April, the Recycling and Disposal Facility (RDF) will move to its spring schedule which includes Sunday hours and the re-opening of the Reusables Area. Read on...

  1. Current Projects

  1. 40B Development Projects

    M.G.L. c.40B authorizes the Zoning Board of Appeals to issue a comprehensive permit to facilitate construction of low- and moderate-income housing. Read on for more info on projects under review...

  2. Hardy, Hunnewell, Upham Facilities Project

    A feasibility study is under way to explore options to renovate or rebuild Hunnewell School. A Special Town Meeting approved funds to study options for Hardy/Upham in a partnership with the MSBA. Additional Info...

  3. Tailby and Railroad Commuter Lots Development Project

    The Town invited proposals from qualified developers to enter into one or more long-term leases to develop the Tailby and Railroad Commuter Parking Lots with affordable and market rate housing that will be owned and operated by the selected developer. Additional Info...

  1. Pay-by-Phone for Parking

    The town has implemented Passport's pay-by-phone mobile parking payment application allowing customers to purchase parking from their smart phone. Additional Info...

  2. Unified Plan

    The Town of Wellesley is currently preparing a Unified Plan, which is a combination of a Comprehensive Plan and a Town-wide Strategic Plan. Additional Info...
View All
/CivicAlerts.aspx
  1. Public Records

On June 3, 2016, Governor Baker signed An Act to Improve Public Records into law. This act requires municipalities to designate 1 or more Records Access Officers (RAO), who shall coordinate the Town's response to requests for access to public records; assist individuals seeking public records in identifying the records requested; and assist the custodian of records in preserving public records. More information on the new Public Records Law is available from the Secretary of the Commonwealth.

At its December 12, 2016 regular meeting, the Board of Selectmen appointed the following individuals as Wellesley RAOs:

  • K.C. Kato, Town Clerk,  525 Washington Street,  781-431-1019 x2280
  • Meghan Jop, Executive Director,  525 Washington Street,  781-431-1019 x2200
  • Lt. Marie Cleary, WPD Support Services Commander,  485 Washington Street,  781-235-1212
  • Cynthia D. Mahr, Asst. Superintendent for Finance and Operations, 40 Kingsbury Street,  781-446-6210 x5611

Wellesley's RAO's may be contacted via email at records@wellesleyma.gov. RAO's have also prepared Public Records Access Guidelines (PDF) to help requestors to make informed requests. Please use the links below for quick access to the most frequently requested public records.
